extendedInfo.description: RoadSync uses Exchange ActiveSync to provide PUSH synchronization with Microsoft Exchange 2003-2010.Key Features:* Now syncs subfolders!* HTML e-mail w/flags* Tasks & Calendar w/widgets* Meeting accept/decline* Contacts w/photos* Global Address List* Attachments* Free 14-day demoON SALE - Just $9.95!

reviews.title: Works well on Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc
reviews.comment: Works well on Sony Ericsson Xperia Arc with Exchange server. The mail arrives quickly. I would like to see new mail more defined so that it is easier to distinguish from read mail. syncing with Notes would be a bonus as well.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No longer works on wifi-only Acer tablet
reviews.comment: I had to re-install after service on my A100 tablet (bad chip for charging battery). It used to work fine on this tablet.  Now I found, like other reviewers, I can\'t get by the initial registration screen -- I get \"No wireless data connection detected\" -- pretty ridiculous, since I just downloaded it over the Internet.  Apparently it\'s now looking for a CELLULAR data connection!  I spent hours scouring the internet, looking through the online manual.  What\'s ironic is that I have Dataviz\'s Documents To Go on the same machine, and it re-installed perfectly -- identical registration screen produced no error message.  I read enough to convince me to give up and switch to Touchdown for syncing with my company\'s MS Exchange server
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works great in nook color w/cm7
reviews.comment: Great if you have folders in your inbox, but it doesn\'t always keep up with Outlook- appointments that I remove on outlook often stay on the phone, some appointnments never sync to the phone. I always have to double check the phone vs my laptop in the morning, and do a total data reset monthly, which is a PIA. Would also like to be able to remove priority and due dates from the tasks filter and just filter by category.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Can\'t uninstall it???
reviews.comment: What the heck is this? I can\'t remove this free version from my phone now that the trial period has ended????  Update! To uninstall this, make sure you go to the phone settings, Device Manager, and uncheck \"RoadSync\".
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good app support sucks
reviews.comment: I have now used this app with two servers.  Works good but i can\'t get contacts to work. Tried contacting support and they won\'t respond. Very frustrated with them. I\'m sadly starting to look for a replacement.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Avoid...
reviews.comment: There\'s no support from the developer.  It looks like they\'ve abandoned it.  App has delays and lockups.  it\'s cheap for a reason!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Won\'t sync on Defy - 2.2
reviews.comment: Looks great, love the interface and have been buying Dataviz products for a million years. Unfortunately RoadSync won\'t connect with our 2010 Exchange Server. http500 error - which Dataviz says is Exchange problem. Touchdown, Outlook and iPhones connect without any problems.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Failed to uninstall
reviews.comment: Email\'s & Calender work as expected. But It\'s not allowing me to uninstall the app. Really buggy software.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Does not work and no support
Multiple level nested folders!!
reviews.comment: If you\'ve got nested folders more than one level deep, this is the Exchange client for you! It\'s the only one I\'ve found that can handle that, and I\'ve looked at pretty much all of the rest of them. Only thing it\'s really missing is multiple calendar support (for calendars that have been shared with you, for instance), but just grab ICSSync for $2 to do that...which is the only calendar sync program to handle THAT for exchange servers. With the 2 of them together, you\'ve finally got Exchange on Android
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Getting worse...
reviews.comment: In early android days this was about the best exchange app.  At some point it went down hill, versions where license checks were failing stopping it from working.  I abandoned using it for a while but since I paid for it, I keep checking if its gotten better, and well it hasn\'t. It can\'t even detect my internet connection on my galaxy tab to get past the registration screen.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Used for months, great tool
reviews.comment: Works incredibly well for my needs. It has been stable and reliable for many months on end. (used with sherweb exchange 2007).
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great customer service!
reviews.comment: I had been using this for a while with no problems but then my G2 got gingerbread and I started having problems.  Customer support gave me a refund.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Clearly this app is no longer supported by Dataviz
reviews.comment: Great product on my old Android phone but refuses to install on my new Nexus 7. Dataviz say they know about the problem but no fix after 2 months. Revision history is not encouraging - lots of updates in 2010, just one in 2011 and none this year.  I bought the Nexus 7 slate mainly for better access to my calendar and email so this is really bad news. Looks like Dataviz have given up on this so don\'t throw your money away.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not bad but
reviews.comment: No ability to sync contacts with android. Very slow after new droid sw update. No ability to sort or search email, calendar is sub par.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: After accepting Lotus Notes 6 invitations the meeting disappear from Calendar. In general, this app freezes on regular basis. Don\'t waste money for it
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Can\'t buy full version for Galaxy Player
reviews.comment: I installed the main (demo) app on my Samsung Galaxy Player 4 and got it working just fine. Tried to buy the full version key but couldn\'t.  Says my device is not supported.  Contacted Dataviz Support twice with no reply.  Demo finally expired.  Now i\'m having trouble uninstalling.  What a huge waste of time.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Worked great until..
reviews.comment: I\'ve used this app for 2.5 years & in the past month it suddenly stopped downloading my attachments. I can view them from touchdown so I know it\'s not my settings or the phone. I don\'t like TD & don\'t want to stop using Roadsync. A fix for this issue would be fantastic!
reviews.author: Cammy Wood

reviews.title: I like the mail interface
reviews.comment: Calendar interface however is ordinary at best. Make it easier to see meeting details in the various calendar views and this will be a five star app!
reviews.author: Matty P

reviews.comment: This is by far the most stable exchange client but the lack of features like email search and no new developments makes it a 3 stars app.
reviews.author: A Google User
